Key Match Events: India won by 7 wickets (with 10 balls remaining)
Aaron Jones epitomised two things that make anything worth watching - skill and flair - as he struck sixes at will and celebrated each of them
Pre-Game Insights: USA go into the game undefeated - with two wins from two - and with every chance of progressing into the Super Eights
India tend not to fuss with their plans unless they absolutely have to
Rohit Sharma (capt), Virat Kohli, Rishabh Pant (wk), Suryakumar Yadav, Shivam Dube, Hardik Pandya, Ravindra Jadeja, Axar Patel, Jasprit Bumrah, Mohammed Siraj, Arshdeep Singh (probable XI for India)
Steven Taylor, Monank Patel (capt & wk), Andries Gous, Aaron Jones, Nitish Kumar, Corey Anderson, Harmeet Singh, Jasdeep Singh, Nosthush Kenjige, Saurabh Netravalkar, Ali Khan (probable XI for USA)
Post-Match Reflections: India won the match and are well placed to make the Super Eights
USA have some work to do, but they won't mind that
USA team themselves have played a part in making the tournament exciting with tight finishes and rapturous upsets
Miscellaneous Highlights: The New York surface has settled enough that the scary up-and-down bounce that was seen earlier in the competition seems to be a thing of the past
Aaron Jones is currently this T20 World Cup's second-highest scorer, with 130 runs from two innings at a strike rate of nearly 197
Jasprit Bumrah has an average of four and an economy rate of 2.85 after picking up five wickets for 20 runs in seven overs this tournament
Others: The game is unlikely to be upset by the weather, but it may once again be low-scoring
The USA team themselves have played a part in making the tournament exciting with tight finishes and rapturous upsets
This will be the first cricket match between India and USA across any format
